snippet: New findings are bolstering the view that mysterious symptoms in Persian Gulf war veterans are fundamentally biological in nature, as opposed to psychological, the result of combat stress.
abstract: Study published in journal PLoS One reports finding neurological damage in Persian Gulf war veterans, bolstering the view that mysterious symptoms are fundamentally biological in nature, as opposed to psychological, resulting from combat stress.
lead_paragraph: New findings are bolstering the view that mysterious symptoms in Persian Gulf war veterans are fundamentally biological in nature, as opposed to psychological, the result of combat stress.

headline.main: Researchers Find Biological Evidence of Gulf War Illnesses
headline.print_headline: Biological Proof Found For Gulf War Illness
